name: Forestry Protection Law
description:
The intent of the law is to protect our forests and ensure the survival of the environment.

The law contents the following articles

**Protection of Endangered Species**
Protects a list of Endangered tree Species

**Forest Planting Subsidy**
The intent is to incentivise citizens to plant more trees by paying them for each tree planted

**Protection of Timber**
The intent of this article is to ensure we get the maximum yield for all trees by protecting trees in their growth cycle

**Forest Landscape Restoration**
This is a collection of the following articles: Tax for Felling Trees, Tax for Creating Tree Debris, Subsidy for Clearing Stumps, Subsidy for Clearing Tree Debris, Citizen Report, Global Report

The intent is to ensure tree debris and stumps are removed when a tree is felled, as debris and tree stumps will block the growth of both trees and plants in the area

properties.Title: Protection of Endangered Species
properties.UserDescription:
This article blocks cutting down trees on the Endangered Species list except if the tree is on the Federal Highway, or in Unica.

Current protected Species: Old Growth Redwoods

Location.tooltip:
When triggered, the <ecoicon item="ChopTree">Action Location</ecoicon> value of the event will be used.

<ecoicon item="ChopTree">Action Location</ecoicon>: The position where the interaction took place.

Districts.internalDescription: 3 Districts3 DistrictsCapital Roads Federal Highways State Routes

properties.Title: Forest Planting Subsidy
properties.UserDescription:
The intent is to incentivise citizens to plant more trees. This is accomplished by giving a monetary payment for every seed planted in accordance with the § 2.3 of the server rules inside dedicated districts named: Altaica forest area, Balica forest area, Sondaica forest area, Virgata forest area

The payment amount is controlled by the Prime Minister.

The following command is available
“!treeSubsidy” - Shows the current payment amount.
“!treeSubsidyUp” - Increase the tree seed payment by 0.1. Available to PM only
“!treeSubsidyDown” - Decrease the tree seed payment by 0.1. Available to PM only

List.internalDescription: 11 Plants11 PlantsBirch Species Cedar Species Ceiba Species Fir Species Joshua Species Oak Species Old Growth Redwood Species Palm Species Redwood Species Saguaro Cactus Species Spruce Species

Location.tooltip:
When triggered, the <ecoicon item="PlantSeeds">Action Location</ecoicon> value of the event will be used.

<ecoicon item="PlantSeeds">Action Location</ecoicon>: The position of the new plant.

Districts.internalDescription: 4 Districts4 Districtsforest area Altaica 2 forest area Balica 2 forest area Sondaica 2 forest area Virgata 2

Target.tooltip:
When triggered, the <ecoicon item="User">Citizen</ecoicon> value of the event will be used.

<ecoicon item="User">Citizen</ecoicon>: The citizen planting the plant.

properties.Title: Protection of Timber
properties.UserDescription:
The intent of this article is to ensure we get the maximum yield for all trees. This is accomplished by creating districts covering ~70% of each state's land. Inside these areas will trees that are under 75% of its growth cycle be protected from being cut down.

Citizens that cut down trees on their own claimed land are able to ignore this rule to ensure it will not block their property expansion. 

Using claimed land to circumvent the article is a criminal offence

Members of the senate can add citizens to the “Protection of Timber” title for the purpose of ignoring the law. This to ensure blocking trees outside of the scope of this article can be removed when needed. The citizens are expected to be removed after the tree has been cut down.

Left.tooltip:
When triggered, the <ecoicon item="ChopTree">Growth Percent</ecoicon> value of the event will be used.

<ecoicon item="ChopTree">Growth Percent</ecoicon>: A value of 100 represents a fully grown tree, 0 represents a newly-planted seed.

When triggered, the <ecoicon item="ChopTree">Growth Percent</ecoicon> value of the event will be used.

<ecoicon item="ChopTree">Growth Percent</ecoicon>: A value of 100 represents a fully grown tree, 0 represents a newly-planted seed.

Citizen.tooltip:
When triggered, the <ecoicon item="User">Citizen</ecoicon> value of the event will be used.

<ecoicon item="User">Citizen</ecoicon>: The citizen who performed the interaction.

When triggered, the <ecoicon item="User">Citizen</ecoicon> value of the event will be used.

<ecoicon item="User">Citizen</ecoicon>: The citizen who performed the interaction.

properties.Title: Forest Restoration - Tax Felling Trees
properties.UserDescription: The intent of this article is to tax citizens when trees are chopped down. But only if that tree would create a stump.

<ecoicon item="ChopTree">Felled</ecoicon>: Was the tree felled?

<ecoicon item="ChopTree">Growth Percent</ecoicon>: A value of 100 represents a fully grown tree, 0 represents a newly-planted seed.

properties.Title: Forest Restoration - Tax Creating Tree Debris
properties.UserDescription: The Intent of this article is to create a tax for the citizen for any tree debris thats created when the citizen chops a tree down.
